alert.note: Alert for Buchanan (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 2:05AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Buchanan County through 300 AM CDT... At 203 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Oelwein to near Jesup to 8 miles south of Hudson. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Torrential rainfall with amounts of over 1 inch in less than an hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Independence, Jesup, Fairbank, Winthrop, Hazleton, Quasqueton, Lamont, Brandon, Rowley, Aurora, Stanley, Lime Creek County Park, Winthrop Golf Course, Wapsipinicon Golf Course, Fontana County Park, Littleton, Monti, Buchanan County Fairgrounds, Otterville and Independence Airport. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 49 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
